metadata.Title: CVE-2023-48795 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: Prefix truncation attack on BPP: By manipulating sequence numbers duringthe handshake, an attacker can remove the initial messages on the securechannel without causing a MAC failure.

criterions.comment: openssh package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
dropbear: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-go.crypto package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
snapd package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
lxd package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
libssh package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
libssh2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
paramiko package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
proftpd-dfsg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
